story: Ahmed Tarek edited a doc in the group: Egyptian Geeks.

data.message: Ahmed Saeed

اولا انا متشكر جدا ع التفصيل والتوضيح الممتع دا ^_^
ومتشكر جدا  ع الاهتمام :)
بس انا عندى سؤال اخير ... هل تركيزك ع ال Web Development دا لانه المستحوز ك Freelancing ولا عشان دا سهل انى ابتدى بيه ؟

غالبا لأنه المستحوز وشغله كتير فى سوق ال freelancing 
لكن طبعا ما يمنعش ان فى مجالات تانيه كتييير منها mobile app و desktop apps دول موجودين فى سوق ال freelance و ليهم clients أنا عن نفسى اشتغلت فى المجال دا لأنى بحبه و أول ما بدأت أتعلم اتعلمت web developing :)
انت لو دخلت على freelancer أو Odesk هتلاقى مجالات كتير فوق ما تتخيل
تمام .... متشكر جداااً ي هندسة :))

أنا عاوز كمان أقولك ان ممكن تتعلم Wordpress أو Joomla و تعمل مواقع من غير ما تحتاج أصلا تبرمج ... يا دوب بس تتعلم حبه HTML و CSS عشان لو اتطلب منك تعدل فى موقع 
هحط لينكات فوق دلوقتى ليهم
انا اشتغلت ع Drupal قبل كدا بس قبل ما اسافر لمجال الشبكات :D
طيب تمام أوى ربنا يكرمك , انت اشتغلت ك freelancer قبل كدا  ب Drupal ؟

لأ موش لدرجة Free lancer يعنى ... كنت محتاج اعمل Website معين لشركة بتقدم  Security Solutions كتحدى موش اكتر , عملت Prototype صغير كدا ليها بس طبعا لقحوه ف الزبالة ... لان الموضوع  ودى , وكدا " Just for challenge "
هم الخسرانين :D
اكييييد :D :D

Ahmed Tarek usually I don't nitpick things but the amount of errors forced the following list of corrections, take it with a grain of salt:

- PHP is not a programming language, it's a scripting language
- Javascript is not a programming language, it's a scripting language

- Front-end engineering/development =/= Web design in layman's terms. The term is rather broad and is used in many contexts for different reasons, but for the sake of what's written; you've already covered part of it with HTML/CSS & Javascript and it's not limited to UI development.

- Ruby on Rails and Django are not languages, they're frameworks and Joomla, Wordpress and the likes are not frameworks. 

Joomla is what we call a CMF (Content management frameworks) It does build on top of an MVC framework that can be used separately but that's irrelevant to calling Joomla itself a web framework.

And Wordpress is an extendable blog engine. Both of which are far from a what a web framework is all about.

- MySQL is not a programming language for programming databases, MySQL is a database product, SQL is also not a programming language but a data query language.

Best of luck.

Thank you Hady Ahmed for your feedback yes there are many errors , but I think PHP is a scripting language also used as general purpose programming language :) , also i didn't say that JS is limited to UI development I already said that you can make client side web applications using JS :)
I will correct the errors
JS , PHP , Ruby and Python are programming languages but they don't require a compiler as you know you can look up for their definitions on wiki ^_^

You're most welcome, happy to help. However.. you left me no choice :)

The usage of php as a general purpose programming language is still very much limited by design.

I didn't say JS is limited to UI. 
I said front-end is not limited to UI. There is a lot that goes into front-end engineering aside UI.

JS is not a programming language and never will be.
Again, PHP is a scripting language.

A programming language can be compiled and/or interpreted. 

It's the:
- Purpose
- Intention & Intended usage
- Design 
- Most common usage 
- Implementation scope and breadth 

that decide whether it's indeed a feature-full programming language useable for the design and implementation of any and all kinds of systems or not.

Compilers and interpreters are _implementation details_

**Languages are neither compiled nor interpreted** 

The implementation decides that. 

Python code in most cases is  _compiled_ into bytecode which gets _interpreted_ by CPython.

JIT compiled by PyPy, so that's machine code right there.

There are implementations for .NET (IronPython), JVM bytecode (Jython)

Ruby code can be compiled to native code (MacRuby) or through Rubinius, the standard MRI is an interpreter.

v8 snapshots compiles your JS code to machine code and lets you distribute executable binaries. 

However (since JS is a _scripting language by design_) the code is included with the binary, loaded in memory. Why? Because calling a toString on a JS function will spit out its code.

The spectrum of compilers and interpreters is wide, majority of languages are either compiled and/or interpreted, there's always a mix.

Maybe esoteric languages are an exception but heck, there are brainfuck implementations that compile to machine code. 
You can interpret brainfuck in 50+ lines of ruby code.

JS, PHP = scripting languages
Ruby, Python = general purpose programming languages

Good luck.
Hady Ahmed: well I have to say that some developers consider scripting languages to be a subset of programming languages, I'm NOT one of these people, but they exist :D

Hassan Aly Selim it saddens me when I meet them. I've known some who considered XML to be a scripting language :D
IIRC, I saw an argument over irc once  that ddl is db programming lang. Counter argument was a shocker, that ddl isn't a subset of sql it just shares the same syntax... -_-
Ok i get it now

Ok, I have a question. I already know html, css, javascript, php, codeigniter (php framework), sql, and even python. Now what is your guys' advice for me to find web development work, freelance or not, given I'm not a computer science graduate at all?

Ahmed Hassan: I think you can start with small freelance stuff, but prepare for some bahdala because the client and the developer expectation/interpretation RARELY match, always make sure you know everything about the project before starting!
Hassan Aly Selim: But where do you think I could find such small freelance stuff?

Ahmed Hassan: I don't really know, some people say they managed to do stuff online, the freelance web dev I did came to me, someone searched and reached my personal website (which has my CV and links to all my social media profiles).
So you'll have to ask someone else on how to actually find freelance opportunities :)
Hassan Aly Selim: Right, thanks :)
